Package org.neo4j.kernel.api.index

Interface IndexProgressor

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BridgingIndexProgressor, DocValuesCollector.LongValuesIndexProgressor, FilteringNativeHitIndexProgressor, FulltextIndexProgressor, NativeHitIndexProgressor, NativeIndexProgressor, NodeLabelSecurityFilter, NodeValueClientFilter, TokenScanValueIndexProgressor
    public interface IndexProgressor
extends AutoCloseable
    The index progressor is a cursor like class, which allows controlled progression through the entries of an index. In contrast to a cursor, the progressor does not hold value state, but rather attempts to write the next entry to a Client. The client can them accept the entry, in which case next() returns, or reject it, in which case the progression continues until an acceptable entry is found, or the progression is done. A Progressor is expected to feed a single client, which is set up for example in the constructor. The typical interaction goes something like: -- query(client) -> INDEX progressor = new Progressor( client ) client.initialize( progressor, ... ) -- next() --> client client ---- next() --> progressor <-- accept() -- :false <-- accept() -- :false <-- accept() -- :true client <-------------- <-----------

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static interface  IndexProgressor.EntityTokenClient
      Client which accepts nodes and some of their labels.
      static interface  IndexProgressor.EntityValueClient
      Client which accepts nodes and some of their property values.

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void close()
      Close the progressor and all attached resources.
      boolean next()
      Progress through the index until the next accepted entry.

    • Field Detail

      • EMPTY

        static final IndexProgressor EMPTY

    • Method Detail

      • next

        boolean next()
        Progress through the index until the next accepted entry. Entries are feed to a Client, which is setup in an implementation specific way.
        Returns:
        true if an accepted entry was found, false otherwise

      • close

        void close()
        Close the progressor and all attached resources. Idempotent.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
